Title: anyarray @> anyarray
Description: Does the first array contain the second, that is, does each element appearing in the second array equal some element of the first array? (Duplicates are not treated specially, thus ARRAY[1] and ARRAY[1,1] are each considered to contain the other.)

Title: anyarray <@ anyarray
Description: Is the first array contained by the second?

Title: anyarray && anyarray
Description: Do the arrays overlap, that is, have any elements in common?

Title: anycompatiblearray || anycompatiblearray
Description: Concatenates the two arrays. Concatenating a null or empty array is a no-op; otherwise the arrays must have the same number of dimensions (as illustrated by the first example) or differ in number of dimensions by one (as illustrated by the second). If the arrays are not of identical element types, they will be coerced to a common type (see Section 10.5).

Title: anycompatible || anycompatiblearray
Description: Concatenates an element onto the front of an array (which must be empty or one-dimensional).

Title: anycompatiblearray || anycompatible
Description: Concatenates an element onto the end of an array (which must be empty or one-dimensional).
